title: Open Call: WolfWords Poetry Anthology 2026
body: We are delighted to announce the open call for this year’s WolfWords anthology. The theme for this year’s collection is 'lost and found'.

title: Myths About Pangolins and Why They Matter
body: How do myths about pangolins contribute to their decline toward extinction, and how might understanding these beliefs be used to improve their conservation?
speaker: Dr Martin Walsh

title: WES Workshop: Pitching Examples
body: Learn about effective pitching from the examples of established entrepreneurs.
speaker: Dr Chris Coleridge

title: Shot of Science
body: An informal and varied night of science, conversation, and pizza.

title: Between Profit and Prevention: Industry, responsibility and planetary health in practice
body: The event will explore how theory, power and practice intersect in real-world efforts to shape healthier and more climate-resilient urban futures globally.

title: Art Exhibition: 'Life and Experience'
body: Visit Wolfson's latest exhibition 'Life and Experience' featuring work by contemporary artist Janette Parris.

title: Lunchtime Concert - Songs of a Night Wanderer
body: Hugo Williamson (Tenor) and Tom Williamson (Piano) present a recital of English and American song.

title: 'Desi Queers': Celebrating South Asian LGBTQ+ Lives in Britain
body: Celebrate Queer History Month with Rohit Dasgupta, co-author of Desi Queers, exploring how South Asian queer communities shaped Britain’s LGBTQ+ movements since the 1970s.
speaker: Dr Rohit K Dasgupta & Dr Anjali Bhardwaj-Datta

title: WES Workshop: Venture Capital Session
body: The objective of this workshop is to help shape the communication of business ideas with a focus on raising capital and being able to effectively answer the “so what?”
speaker: Dr Alisa Molotova

title: Attendance Matters—But How? Understanding the Factors Linking Attendance and Academic Achievement
body: A research event exploring why attendance matters, examining behaviour, motivation and emotion to understand how absences shape academic achievement.

title: Bring Your Research Questions! - Part II
body: A relaxed drop-in session to explore your research ideas, refine questions and methods, and share progress with fellows and subject specialists while sparking new thinking in a supportive academic community.

title: Celebrate World Wildlife Day!
body: This World Wildlife Day, step into the world of amazing invertebrates! Join Phil Barber’s interactive Incredible Inverts & Other Animals session and meet tarantulas, beetles, and more.

title: Wolfson Howler with Jin Hao Li
body: Join us for a night of laughter at our legendary Howler with headliner Jin Hao Li.
speaker: Celya AB

title: Multilingual Mauritius: Insights from Discourse, Interviews, and the Linguistic Landscape
body: What can we learn about Mauritian multilingualism by looking at different scales?
speaker: Dr Hannah Davidson

title: Models of Large Language Models
body: A lunchtime seminar with Professor Ann Copestake who will explain the conceptual underpinnings of the Large Language Models that underpin ChatGPT.
speaker: Professor Ann Copestake

title: WES Workshop: Testing Your Idea
body: A transformative workshop exploring the art of finding repeatable and scalable business models.
speaker: Dr Chris Coleridge

title: A Year of Slow Reading
body: You may well have seen the UK government's Go All In campaign for the National Year of Reading and we invite you to join us for A Year of Slow Reading.

title: The Sixth Annual Wolfson Sir David Williams Law Society Event
body: The Wolfson Sir David Williams Law Society invites you to the 6th Annual Wolfson Law Event, featuring expert panels on environmental and international law, networking, and dining.

title: A Night At The Opera
body: A magical evening of operatic favourites, performed by outstanding Cambridge students and alumni, accompanied by a chamber orchestra.

title: Dazed and Confused: How to Make Sense of the New Era of Geo Economics
body: Join us this International Women’s Day for insights into geo-economics, as Gillian Tett discusses global power and markets with Wolfson President Professor Dame Ijeoma Uchegbu.
speaker: Gillian Tett

title: Sketches from behind the Lens: The Unexpected Challenges of Making a Film about Public Health and the Pandemic in the United States today
body: Join filmmaker Professor James Le Sueur as he shares the story of his documentary film, Seasons of COVID, which chronicles the human experience during the COVID-19 pandemic, exploring the chaos, challenges, and societal debates that emerged with each passing season.
speaker: Professor James Le Sueur

title: Pi (π) Day estimation event
body: Join us this Pi Day to estimate the value of the circle constant and feast on pies!

title: Wolfson Annual Global Health Research Conference - Global Health in a Changing World
body: Join us for the “Global Health in a Changing World” conference, where students, researchers, and leaders explore pressing global health issues, from funding and equity to disease and innovation.

title: Wolfson Entrepreneurship Competition Final & Dinner 2026
body: Discover groundbreaking ideas and cutting-edge solutions as Cambridge’s brightest entrepreneurial minds compete for prizes over £10,000.

title: Lent Term Concert: Of Wild Nights and New Light
body: Wolfson College Choir presents an evening of music at this end of term concert.

title: WES Workshop: Introduction to IP Law
body: Empower your entrepreneurial journey by gaining essential insights into Intellectual Property Law.
speaker: Christian Bunke & Richard Bickford-Smith

title: Cambridge Festival - Wolfson Gardens Discovery Tour
body: Enjoy the beauty of early spring in the Wolson College Gardens.

title: Symposium on Venture Builders
body: Bridging Academic Insight and Practical Innovation in Startup Creation

title: Bridges and Battlefields in Education: Reflections on embedding 'diverse', critical, and anti-racist approaches in schools
body: The second event of this year’s annual 'Hierarchies of Racism?' series, focusing on race, racialisation, and racism within higher education institutions.
speaker: Dr Sharon Walker & Dr Sundeep Lidher
